definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to raise one's voice/to speak at the top of one's voice
erhua variant of 嗓子眼[sang3 zi5 yan3]
off-key singing voice/sb who sings off-key

sentences.english: Old Major cleared his throat and began to sing.
sentences.chinese: 老麦哲清了清嗓子开始唱歌。

sentences.english: Masa, " he said, having cleared his throat several times."
sentences.chinese: “玛莎，”他清了几个嗓子后说道。

sentences.english: Hitoshi was going to say goodbye, but his father cleared his throat.
sentences.chinese: 仁正要说再见，可是他父亲清了清嗓子。

sentences.english: The words are some fancies that tie up Mian, the left Zheng feels throat some Yangs Yang, the eyelid lets go of.
sentences.chinese: 话有些缠绵意，左筝觉得嗓子有些痒痒，眼帘放下。

sentences.english: but he could not get the words out of his parched throat.
sentences.chinese: 焦干的嗓子却吐不出一个字。

sentences.english: He wiped his nose on his cuff and cleared his throat.
sentences.chinese: 他用袖口擦擦鼻子，清了清嗓子。

sentences.english: He caught a cold and got a stuffed / stuffed up nose and a sore throat.
sentences.chinese: 他感冒了，鼻子不通，嗓子疼。

sentences.english: He cleared his throat, and went on with his summing-up report.
sentences.chinese: 他清了清嗓子，继续做总结报告。

sentences.english: His friend cleared his throat loudly.
sentences.chinese: 他的朋友大声地清了清嗓子。

sentences.english: " No ! No ! " you might shout yourself hoarse.
sentences.chinese: 别这样，你会把嗓子喊哑的。

sentences.english: I wake up the next day with a sore throat.
He lifted his voice and brayed , but then everyone knew him.
sentences.chinese: 它扬着嗓子叫了起来，但每个人都知道了是驴子。

sentences.english: I sang till my voice broke.
sentences.chinese: 一直唱到我的嗓子劈了。

sentences.english: My heart stopped in my throat as it happened.
sentences.chinese: 它发生时，我的心激动地悬在了嗓子眼。

sentences.english: I have a very bed cough and sore throat.
sentences.chinese: 我咳嗽咳得很厉害，嗓子也很痛。

sentences.english: He had a sore throat, so he turned away from drinking and smoking.
sentences.chinese: 他嗓子疼，所以他不想抽烟喝酒。

definition: (onom.) sound of cawing/sound of infant learning to talk/variant of 呀[ya1]
to raise one's voice/to speak at the top of one's voice
sound of sighing/(interjection expressing surprise, sorrow, regret, disappointment etc) oh/damn/wow
to roar/to howl/to shriek/roar or howl of an animal/bellow of rage
to yell/to shout/to call out for (a person)
